availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: George W. Thompson (Green County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier)

body.p: Green County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier. Kentucky native. Married to Elizabeth C. Thompson. Father of Milton W. Thompson, Olivia B. Thompson, and John M. Thompson. Farmer in Green County, Kentucky, in 1860. Owned two enslaved persons in Green County in 1860. Served in the 13th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as a first lieutenant and captain from December 30, 1861 to January 12, 1865.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Green County, District 2, p. 600.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Green County, District 2, p. 75B.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hart County, Precinct 5, p. 244B.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers Who Served in Organizations From the State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 0268.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 1, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), p. 856-7.
